Articles.Content:
We\'ve landed on the Mun!!!!!!

Intrepid ML V (Mun Lander)

On the surface:

Sadly, the brave crew was lost in space. They are currently orbiting Kerbin without fuel. Had plenty of fuel leaving the Mun, but Mission Control, having never had to worry about their return, miscalculated the burn and left them stranded. So long, brave crew.
That is one hell of a rocket dude! I like it quite a bit.

Thanks!

Got me there with quite a bit of fuel to spare. The lander isn\'t the most glamorous thing out there, but it got the job done. The lander handles like a bus, but I wanted a wide stance for landing as my other attempts tipped over a lot.

Ah, you can still have a small, wide lander. One small fuel tank, three radially attached, two standard lander legs attached to each for stability. One engine under each fuel tank. Maneuverable and easy to land

Has enough thrust for you to attach a second tank to the main stack and usually an ASAS as well as an RCS tank or two.

Wow, that\'s a meaty-looking lander!

Do you say that to everyone who uses a lander that has radial tanks?

That\'s not to say that this particular lander isn\'t ridiculously huge though.

Actually, looking at it, it\'s not that big. It looks big due to the half-size stock parts he uses as radial tanks. Look at the core, and you\'ll see a capsule, ASAS, FLT-500 tank and novapunch 1m lander engine.

That said, nice work!

Nice landing

You can always edit your persistence file to give yourself more fuel if you really want them to land, and pretend you rendezvoused with a tanker!
Congrats! I landed safely for my first time yesterday an it was awesome.

Actually, looking at it, it\'s not that big. It looks big due to the half-size stock parts he uses as radial tanks. Look at the core, and you\'ll see a capsule, ASAS, FLT-500 tank and novapunch 1m lander engine.

That said, nice work!

ohhh.

OHHHHH.

well then, that lander\'s tiny.

Ahh! Epic optical illusion!

Wow, it actually is quite small. It sure looks HUGE at first sight tho xD

Ahh! Epic optical illusion!

Wow, it actually is quite small. It sure looks HUGE at first sight tho xD

Unfortunately, that\'s what she said. ;P

Yeah, it\'s pretty small, but it handles like a 747. My first launch proved that I needed a LOT more RCS tanks as it\'s heavily dependent on them. I think that now that I know what I\'m doing I could probably ditch some fuel to keep it lighter. I\'ve created a new ship for Minimus...it\'s a monster. Loads of fuel on that one, more than I need! However, the only time you have too much fuel is when you\'re on fire. 8)
All you need for a lander is 1 fT-500 or 250 and a lander engine + legs. Works like a charm.
Once I get a few more landings under my belt I\'ll simplify the design. Just wanted to make sure I could land and get back! 8)
Try it with stock parts next.

Challenge accepted!!

...except for lander legs...I\'ll still need those, right? Or is there a way around \'em?

Full game, 0.14 and beyond, has stock landing legs. if your on the demo, use winglets as makeshift legs. Just make sure to spam struts.

For example, this could work as a landing stage.

Do you say that to everyone who uses a lander that has radial tanks?

That\'s not to say that this particular lander isn\'t ridiculously huge though.

Just to everyone whose lander looks meaty!

Full game, 0.14 and beyond, has stock landing legs. if your on the demo, use winglets as makeshift legs. Just make sure to spam struts.

For example, this could work as a landing stage.

Ok, I\'ve got the full game. Thanks.
